revised_title: Edmund Neville Nevill: A Pioneering Astronomer and Chemist
tldr: Edmund Neville Nevill was a passionate amateur astronomer and chemist who made significant contributions to the study of the Moon. He authored a widely recognized treatise on selenography, conducted research on the Moon's motion, and played a role in the establishment of the Institute of Chemistry. Nevill's work laid the foundation for further advancements in lunar research and the understanding of the Moon's complex motion.
